title: Curate File Collections
text: can merge file collections collated. operation returns union files. design, one file collection object stores metadata files single package. Therefore, merging file collections different packages result error.
code: library("pkglite") pkg <- system.file("examples/pkg1/", package = "pkglite")  fc <- merge(   pkg %>% collate(file_root_core()),   pkg %>% collate(file_r()),   pkg %>% collate(file_r(), file_man()) )  fc #> -- File collection ------------------------------------------------------- #> -- Package: pkg1 --------------------------------------------------------- #>                path_rel format #> 1           DESCRIPTION   text #> 2             NAMESPACE   text #> 3               NEWS.md   text #> 4             README.md   text #> 5              R/data.R   text #> 6             R/hello.R   text #> 7      R/pkg1-package.R   text #> 8         R/sysdata.rda binary #> 9        man/dataset.Rd   text #> 10   man/hello_world.Rd   text #> 11  man/pkg1-package.Rd   text #> 12 man/figures/logo.png binary

title: Represent Packages with pkglite.txt
text: Unless specified, output file automatically named. single R package named pkg1 packed pkg1.txt. Multiple R packages named pkg1, pkg2, … packed pkglite.txt. file extension .txt one can recognize, open, inspect directly using regular text editors.

title: Represent Packages with pkglite.txt
text: overall goal make file format unambiguous, human-friendly, machine-readable. pkglite.txt, follow DCF (Debian Control File) format, used Debian, R, RStudio IDE. minimalist, time-tested format allows us save key-value data plain text humans can easily read write. format also extendable include information assets packed.

title: Represent Packages with pkglite.txt
text: pkglite.txt structured following rules: One file contains multiple DCF format blocks. block includes metadata content one file R package. block separated blank line. last block trailing blank line.

title: Represent Packages with pkglite.txt
text: block least four key-value pairs called fields. example: keys values fields separated colon whitespace except Content, whose value part starts new line.
code: Package: pkglite File: R/pkglite-package.R Format: text Content:   #' @keywords internal   "_PACKAGE"

title: Represent Packages with pkglite.txt
text: R package name. Since one pkglite.txt might contain files multiple packages, field used declare package file explicitly. design implies pkglite.txt can store multiple R packages unique names.

title: Compact Package Representations
text: pkglite offers solution converting R package source code compact, text-based representation restore source package structure representation. three specific aims: provide tool packing restoring R packages plain text assets easy store, transfer, review. provide grammar specifying file packing scope functional, precise, extendable. provide standard exchanging packed asset unambiguous, human-friendly, machine-readable. achieve goals, developed pipe-friendly workflow, concept file specifications file collections, format specification output file pkglite.txt. designs allow us leave clear skimmable trace code generating compact representations, thus improves reproducibility.

title: Compact Package Representations
text: demonstrate basic usage pkglite, show pack unpack one multiple R packages.
code: library("pkglite")

title: Compact Package Representations
text: First, locate input package directory output file: Use following chain calls pack default set files R package directory pkg file txt: collate() function evaluates one file specifications generate file collection. fully determine scope files pack . details, check vignette("filespec", package = "pkglite"). Check first lines output file: Check number lines output file:
code: pkg <- system.file("examples/pkg1", package = "pkglite") txt <- tempfile(fileext = ".txt") pkg %>%   collate(file_default()) %>%   pack(output = txt, quiet = TRUE) txt %>%   readLines() %>%   head(11) %>%   cat(sep = "\n") #> # Generated by pkglite: do not edit by hand #> # Use pkglite::unpack() to restore the packages #>  #> Package: pkg1 #> File: DESCRIPTION #> Format: text #> Content: #>   Package: pkg1 #>   Type: Package #>   Title: Example Package One #>   Version: 0.1.0 txt %>%   readLines() %>%   length() #> [1] 1081

title: Compact Package Representations
text: unpack (restore) file structures text file, use unpack(): create directory named R package output directory: install packages unpacking , use unpack(..., install = TRUE).
code: out <- file.path(tempdir(), "onepkg") txt %>% unpack(output = out, quiet = TRUE) out %>%   file.path("pkg1") %>%   list.files() #> [1] "data"        "DESCRIPTION" "man"         "NAMESPACE"   "NEWS.md"     #> [6] "R"           "README.md"   "vignettes"

title: Compact Package Representations
text: pack() accepts one input directories. Therefore, one can pack multiple R packages (file collections) one file : Since two example packages almost identical content, number lines text file doubled (three header lines excluded):
code: pkg1 <- system.file("examples/pkg1", package = "pkglite") pkg2 <- system.file("examples/pkg2", package = "pkglite")  fc1 <- pkg1 %>% collate(file_default()) fc2 <- pkg2 %>% collate(file_default())  pack(fc1, fc2, output = txt, quiet = TRUE) txt %>%   readLines() %>%   length() #> [1] 2159
